column6: We've been investing to improve the validating quality and our capabilities to contribute to ecosystem. B-Harvest members are core developers of Cosmos SDK, but not dedicated to validator operations. So we have fully-dedicated engineers who have expertise on cloud architecture and SW engineering, and in the process of hiring a developer for validator related code/tooling contributions. After complete the dedicated workforce setup we expect we do proactive contributions to the ecosystem by leveraging our core SDK developers' expertise.
We set the highest standards for ourselves, for maximum transparency, security and reliability for our customers and partners.
We see ourselves as the small operator that adds value to the decentralisation and liveness aspect of a chain

I can guarantee that my validator will be updated in a timely manner, fully protected, with high uptime and hot backup with a second node in case of problems with the main node. .I use industry standard monitoring to ensure continuous uptime and a high level of security around hot and cold wallets to ensure safe operations. 24hr management & monitoring! (Grafana + Prometeus + Telegram alerts);

The team consists of more than 30 team members with software engineering backgrounds. We have a great experience with Tendermint blockchains ( Sifchain \| Umee \|  Agoric \| Archway \| Evmos \| Celestia \| Quicksilver \| Defund) as well as other L1 / L2 blockchains (Polygon \| Elrond \| Avalanche \| Casper \| ) and Substrate based blockchains (Moonbeam \| Astar \| Composable Finance \| Polkadex \| OAK network). We are also involved in highly technical Indexer setups like The Graph, Covalent, SubQuery and also provide support for different bridging technologies (Connext \| Axelar \| deBridge). 

Also, our main product is https://blastapi.io - the Decentralized API Platform, where we support more than 25 Networks(mainnet +testnets), with RPCs, WSS and Public .

Hey there! My name is Sergio. I am Individual Professional Proof of Stake Network Validator.

I help crypto projects to test their networks, and then I validate in mainnets. I have been doing this for almost 2 years and have gained a lot of experience.

I actively participating in crypto community life: creating guides and developing tools for community to make node operators life easier. Also glad to help projects by providing my highly secure and reliable infrastructure.

My services include running RPC nodes, running State Sync services and IBC relayers. I also are developing tools to help community and projects.

I do not use cheap servers, only powerful and reliable servers. This allows my to uncompromisingly ensure reliability and availability of data, as well as high uptime of my nodes. In addition, the use of multi-level monitoring systems Grafana + Prometeus + Telegram/Discord alerts allows to solve non-trivial problems quickly and efficiently.

Website: https://ppnv.space

Howdy, I'm Alex, aka doxe experienced web3 enthusiast, contributor, moderator and PoS/PoW validator, also just a friendly person.

In general, my main goal and vision is to help newbies and make their acquaintance with the world of crypto and tesnets in general easier, for this purpose I support guides for different projects in which I am involved or at people's request. At this stage, I write them in English, as I consider this language the most important one for understanding in web3. Also, I support Ukrainian, as it's my native language, and I understand Russian at the advance level. I often initiate the creation of thematic chats in telegram or other social networks to support people in the local language. There, together with other participants, I try to maintain interesting communication and help each other in case of any questions, issues and etc.

All in all, I've been doing this for about 1 year, and am very happy and favourable about it. I keep a close eye on each of my validators and responsibly monitor their health, security, updates and other parameters to ensure that they function consistently and correctly on the server.

Additionally, we have social media, through which we introduce people to the projects that we validate. We make video clips about the projects, we make textual material for the community.

OptimusValidatorNetwork was born at the beginning of 2021, when we started digging into the Crypto world and started to use our background and skills to support new projects. Since then we have supported over 20 projects. Now we have ~20 servers between instances and dedicated. Each of our mainnet node has a backup node and automated scripting to launch it if a fault in the main node is detected. We continuously improve automation and monitoring.
With your help we can strive to go green and offset our energy use!

[NODERS]TEAM is part of the developing ecosystem Goshu Alliance aimed at developing the community in various crypto projects (From projects with nodes to various game projects)

[NODERS]TEAM - a team of professional developers with more than five years of experience in the IT field.
At the moment, our main goal is to participate in various testnets of projects built on different networks and help in building a strong community.

We help both with the organization of testnets and with their support (Moderation, assistance in writing technical documentation, helping the community get acquainted with the project, writing guides, holding AMAs, etc.)

Also, one more of our global goals is to automate the validator management process and simplify it by writing an application for this process, as well as further growth into a large staking platform.

This application will perform the function of writing commands on the server, but through telephones using predefined commands for a specific project. You will only need to click on the button you need (It will increase the stake, withdraw rewards, vote, check the status of the node and the validator, etc.)

We are also engaged in writing statesyncs, relayers, snapshots and everything that can simplify the installation of a node and track its state.

We are currently participating in several public and closed testnets. We have several nodes in the mainnet with stakes from projects, and we are also writing a large website where all our developments for testnets will be collected, all projects in which we participate and will participate, guides, statesinks, bots for TG and much more
